trans-unit.source: Represents the geometry of a circle or ellipse.

Use the EllipseGeometry class with a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Path> element or a <xref:System.Windows.Media.GeometryDrawing> to draw an ellipse, or with the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Clip%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> to define an elliptical clip region.
The EllipseGeometry class also has many other uses.
For more information about EllipseGeometry, see [Geometry Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

EllipseGeometry Compared to Ellipse The <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse> class has a <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.Fill%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Shape.Stroke%2A>, and other rendering properties that EllipseGeometry lacks.

The <xref:System.Windows.Shapes.Ellipse> class is a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> and therefore participates in the layout system; it can be used as the content of any element that supports <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> children.
The EllipseGeometry class, on the other hand, simply defines the geometry of an ellipse, and cannot render itself.
Because of its simplicity, it has a wider range of uses.
Freezable Features An EllipseGeometry is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object and therefore can be frozen to improve performance.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> class that has a horizontal diameter equal to the width of the passed <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>, a vertical diameter equal to the length of the passed <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>, and a center point location equal to the center of the passed <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref>.
The rectangle that describes the ellipse dimensions.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> class as an ellipse that has a specified center location, x radius, and y radius.
The location of the center of the ellipse.
The horizontal radius of the ellipse.
The vertical radius of the ellipse.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> class that has the specified position, size, and transformation.
The location of the center of the ellipse.
The horizontal radius of the ellipse.
The vertical radius of the ellipse.
The transformation to apply to the ellipse.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that represents the bounding box of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
This method does not consider the extra area potentially added by a stroke.
The bounding box of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
Gets or sets the center point of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The center point of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry.Center*> dependency property.
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Gets the area of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
Some <xref:System.Windows.Media.Geometry> methods (such as GetArea) produce or use a polygonal approximation of the geometry.
The tolerance factor specifies the maximum distance between points in this polygonal approximation.
Smaller tolerance values produce better approximations, but they require more processing than an approximation with a large tolerance factor.
The maximum bounds on the distance between points in the polygonal approximation of the geometry.
Smaller values produce more accurate results but cause slower execution.
If `tolerance` is less than .000001, .000001 is used instead.

One of the enumeration values, <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ToleranceType"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.ToleranceType"></xref>, that specifies whether the tolerance factor is an absolute value or relative to the area of this geometry.
The area of the filled region of this ellipse.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> object is empty.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> is empty; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> object can have curved segments.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref> object can have curved segments; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the x-radius value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The x-radius value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry.RadiusX*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets or sets the y-radius value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The y-radius value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Media.EllipseGeometry.RadiusY*> dependency property.
To be added.
